action.action-desc: Mr. Stivers (for himself, Mr. Loebsack, and Mr. Rodney Davis of Illinois) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services, and in addition to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the definition of homeless person under the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act to include certain homeless children and youth, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Homeless Children and Youth Act of 2015.

section.header: Amendments to the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act
section.text: The McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 11301 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a)—

subclause.text: by striking are sharing and all that follows through charitable organizations,;
by striking 14 days each place that term appears and inserting 30 days;
in clause (i), by inserting or after the semicolon;
by redesignating clause (iii) as clause (ii); and

clause.text: by amending paragraph (6) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: unaccompanied youth and homeless families with children and youth defined as homeless under other Federal statutes who—

subparagraph.text: are certified as homeless by the director or designee of a director of a program funded under any other Federal statute; or

have been certified by a director or designee of a director of a program funded under this Act or a director or designee of a director of a public housing agency as lacking a fixed, regular, and adequate nighttime residence, which shall include—

clause.text: temporarily sharing the housing of another person due to loss of housing, economic hardship, or other similar reason; or
living in a room in a motel or hotel.

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: the term other Federal statute has the meaning given that term in section 401; and
the term public housing agency means an agency described in section 3(b)(6) of the United States Housing Act of 1937 (42 U.S.C. 1437a(b)(6)).

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1)(C)—

clause.text: by redesignating clauses (v), (vi), and (vii) as clauses (iv), (v), and (vi);

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (7)—

clause.text: by striking Federal statute other than this subtitle and inserting other Federal statute; and
by inserting of before this Act;

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (14) through (33) as paragraphs (15) through (34), respectively; and
by adding after paragraph (13) the following:

paragraph.text: The term other Federal statute includes—

subparagraph.text: the Runaway and Homeless Youth Act (42 U.S.C. 5701 et seq.);
the Head Start Act (42 U.S.C. 9831 et seq.);
subtitle N of the Violence Against Women Act of 1994 (42 U.S.C. 14043e et seq.);
section 330(h) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 254b(h));
section 17 of the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 (42 U.S.C. 1786);
the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1001 et seq.); and
subtitle B of title VII of this Act.

paragraph.text: by inserting after section 408 the following:

section.text: The Secretary shall aggregate and publicly report information provided to the Secretary pursuant to section 402(f)(3) and shall ensure that any public report does not contain personally identifiable information.

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a)—

clause.text: by striking The Secretary and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: In awarding grants under paragraph (1), the Secretary may not consider or prioritize the specific homeless populations intended to be served by the applicant if the applicant demonstrates that the project—

subparagraph.text: would meet the priorities identified in the plan submitted under section 427(b)(1)(B); and
is cost-effective in meeting the overall goals and objectives identified in that plan.
by striking subsection (j);
in paragraph (1)—

subclause.text: in clause (vi), by adding and at the end;
in clause (vii), by striking and at the end; and
in clause (iii), by adding and at the end;
in clause (iv)(VI), by striking and at the end; and

clause.text: in subparagraph (E), by adding and at the end;
by redesignating subparagraph (G) as subparagraph (F); and

subparagraph.text: by striking paragraph (3); and

paragraph.text: by amending section 433 to read as follows:

subsection.text: The Secretary shall submit to Congress an annual report, which shall—

paragraph.text: summarize the activities carried out under this subtitle and set forth the findings, conclusions, and recommendations of the Secretary as a result of the activities; and
include, for the year preceding the date on which the report is submitted—

subparagraph.text: data required to be made publically available in the report submitted under section 409; and
data on programs funded under any other Federal statute, as such term is defined in section 401.

subsection.text: A report under subsection (a) shall be submitted not later than 4 months after the end of each fiscal year.
